snippet: Local officials said the construction of an immense industrial complex in Sichuan province had ended over concerns about its environmental impact.
abstract: Large and sometimes violent protests are key part of China's budding environmental movement and appear to be having some success in pushing for more stringent safeguards on new manufacturing and mining projects; local government of Shifang announces that the construction of the $1.6 billion copper smelting complex has not only been suspended, but also permanently canceled, after protests there.
lead_paragraph: Local officials said the construction of an immense industrial complex in Sichuan province had ended over concerns about its environmental impact.

headline.seo: Budding Environmental Movement Finds Resonance Across China
headline.main: Bolder Protests Against Pollution Win Project’s Defeat in China
headline.print_headline: Budding Environmental Movement Is Finding Resonance Across China
